You cannot edit an invoice once it's been saved.

In order to use Authorize.Net DPM, you must do the following:

1. Log on to the Merchant Interface at https://secure.authorize.net
2. Click Settings under Account in the main menu on the left
3. Click MD5-Hash in the Security Settings section
4. Enter any random value to use for your MD5 Hash Value. Enter the value again to confirm
5. Click Submit
6. Enter the MD5-Hash you just set up into the MD5 Hash setting below

You must also enable IPN from your PayPal account settings. To do this, visit paypal.com and sign in, then go to History --> IPN History and ensure IPN is enabled. If prompted for a URL, use:
{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&validate=paypal
If you already have an IPN specified for other purposes, you do not need to overwrite it.

In order to issue refunds from Nexus, you must create an API Signature. To do this:
1. Log into PayPal, then click Profile under My Account.
2. Click API Access.
3. Click Request API Credentials.
4. Check Request API signature and click Agree and Submit.
If you do not wish to use this functionality, you can ignore the API Username, Password and Signature settings. You must have a PayPal Business account to use this feature.

In order to use 2CheckOut, you must:

Configure your settings
Go to your 2CheckOut Account Settings:

Approved URL - You must set this to:
{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&check=2checkout

Secret Word It is strongly recommended that you change this from the default. Once you have set your secret word, enter it below.

Instant Notification Settings
Now go to the Notification Settings. Set the Global URL to:
{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&validate=2checkout
Then click, 'Apply', 'Enable All Notifications' and 'Save Settings' - all the settings should now be checked and have that URL in the box.

API Details
Now go to the User Management settings. From here, click the Create Username link and create a new username with API Access and API Updating selected for the Access type. Then enter the username and password you created below.

In order to use PayPal Pro you must create an API Signature. To do this:
1. Log into PayPal, then click Profile under My Account.
2. Click API Access.
3. Click Request API Credentials.
4. Check Request API signature and click Agree and Submit.

You must also enable IPN from your PayPal account settings. To do this, visit paypal.com and sign in, then go to History --> IPN History and ensure IPN is enabled. If prompted for a URL, use:
{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&check=paypal

If you already have an IPN specified for other purposes, you do not need to overwrite it.
If you choose the dropdown type, you must enter some options.

In order to use Automated Recurring Billing (ARB) which will allow customers to be automatically billed, you must do the following:

1. Log on to the Merchant Interface at https://secure.authorize.net
2. Click Settings under Account in the main menu on the left
3. Click Silent Post URL in the Transaction Format Settings section
4. Enter "{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&validate=authnet"
5. Click Submit
6. Click MD5-Hash in the Security Settings section
7. Enter any random value to use for your MD5 Hash Value. Enter the value again to confirm
8. Click Submit
9. Enable the ARB setting below and enter the MD5-Hash you just set up into the MD5 Hash setting

You must also enable IPN from your AlertPay account settings. To do this:
1. Visit alertpay.com and sign in
2. Go to My Account --> Profile --> IPN Setup - enter your Transaction PIN and click 'Access'. 3. Set the 'IPN Status' setting to 'Enabled'. A new field called 'Alert URL' will appear, enter:
{board_url}app=nexus&module=payments&section=receive&validate=alertpay
4. Click 'Update'.

In the configuration shown, all customers with a billing address in the United Kingdom will be charged 17.5% tax on items using this tax class, customers in Germany will be charged 19% and all other customers will be charged 10%.

If you have specified Tax Rates dependant on the customer's billing address and the customer does not fall into one of the rates you have specified, you can create a fallback rate by specifying it as 'All Locations'.
In the configuration shown, all customers with a billing address in the United Kingdom will be charged 17.5% tax on items using this tax class. Other customers will not be charged tax.

To create Tax Rates that are dependant on the customer's billing address, uncheck the 'All Locations' checkbox and specify the locations each rate should apply to (you can specify more than one location by holding the Ctrl key and clicking if you are using a PC, or the cmd key if you're using a Mac).
You can add as many rates as is necessary.
In the configuration shown, all customers will be charged 10% tax on items using this tax class.
To create a single tax rate that applies to all customers, regardless of their location, simply select the 'All Locations' checkbox.
Setting up a single Tax Rate

Tax classes define the rules for how tax should be applied to purchases.
You can set up multiple tax classes. Each class defines a set of rates, dependant on the customer's billing address.
Leave value blank to indicate all higher numbers

If selected, support requests created associated with this package, or a parent/child purchase of this package, will automatically be given this severity.
If the above setting is yes, select the department that support requests submitted under this package should go to.

If set to yes, when a user downgrades to this package they will be refunded the difference in the base price between the two packages. If no, users will not be refunded anything when downgrading and will just be billed under the new packages renewal terms.
If yes, users who have purchased other packages in this package's group which are less expensive will be able to upgrade to this package.
Remove added permission sets once expired?
If yes, users who have purchased other packages in this package's group which are more expensive will be able to downgrade to this package.
Return users to previous group once expired?

If set to yes, when a user upgrades to this package they will be charged the difference in the base price between the two packages. If no, users can upgrade without being charged and will just be billed under the new packages renewal terms.

If more than one usergroup discount or a usergroup and a loyalty discount applies, the user will be given the cheapest applicable price.
Add to base price on purchase
Number of days in advance that a user can renew
For example, if your package is set to renew every 7 days and you set this option to 30 days, the user will be able to purchase 4 renewal cycles in advance.

For example, if you have a 30 day package, you may allow the user to renew up to 7 days before it expires. The user will retain the full length of the new subscription.
Leave blank or enter 0 to not allow a renewal before the package expires.
Enter -1 to allow renewal at any time.

If this is a physical item, select the shipping options that should be available.
Leave blank for all options to be available.
Number of days before this package expires that a user can renew

Customers will only be able to pay for this package and renewals for this package with the payment methods selected. Leave blank to enable all methods.
Note that if two packages have no common available methods, customers will not be able to purchase them together.

This will transfer the purchase and all child purchases to another member. Associated invoices will not be transferred.

This purchase has child purchases with grouped renewals. This setting only applies to the renewal price of this purchase itself. The renewal fees of child purchases are added automatically and can be adjusted by editing those purchases.

This purchase has child purchases with grouped renewals. Adjusting the renewal terms will automatically adjust the renewal prices of those children accordingly, however, you will need to adjust the renewal price of this purchase below manually.
Renewals of this purchase are grouped with the parent purchase. Adjusting this price will adjust the renewal price of the parent purchase.

Leave blank to not renew
Note: If you specify no renewals, but leave an expire date above, the package will expire as normal.

Do not select any to allow all members to use this code.

If yes, the discount will only be applied the products specified above.
For example, if the code is for a 50% discount and the user purchases one of the products specified above, and another product - if this setting is yes, 50% of the first item will be deducted and the second item will be charged at full price; if this setting is no, 50% will be deducted from the total amount to pay.
Number of allowed uses per member
If yes, this coupon will also be able to be used against renewals of the products specified. If no, it will only be useable against new purchases.
Do not select any to allow this code to be used against all products.

Marked for Review: The transaction is being reviewed and awaiting approval.
Pending: Waiting for payment to arrive.
Pending: The user initiated the transaction but has not yet completed it.
On Hold: The transaction is awaiting your approval.
Complete: The transaction was completed successfully.
Canceled: The invoice was not paid and has been canceled. User can not pay invoice.
Expired: This invoice had not been paid within 10 days of being generated and has expired. Mark as pending to allow the user to pay the invoice.
Pending: This invoice has not yet been paid.

Profit/Loss is an estimate of the monthly revenue from hosting accounts on that server subtract the server cost. Where users pay in a cycle other than monthly, the calculation is made assuming 30 days and 4 weeks in a month. The number is rounded to the nearest penny.

This condition requires that the customer's billing address and phone number be provided. If the customer's billing address or phone number is unknown, this condition will not be checked - you may want to set the billing address and phone number to be required.

This condition requires that the customer's billing address be provided. If the customer's billing address is unknown, this condition will not be checked - you may want to set the billing address to be required.

You may leave any of the conditions empty to disable.
When a customer makes a purchase, the rules here will be checked in order. The last rule in the list which applies is the action which will be taken.
This is just used for your reference to identify the rule.
There are several additional conditions which can be checked if MaxMind integration is enabled.
Could not locate the commission rule you are trying to edit.
You must enter a name for the rule.
You must enter a commission amount.
This is the maximum amount of commission that will be awarded. Leave blank for no limit.

If the customer makes a purchase which includes the specified packages, but other packages as well, this setting controls whether the commission awarded includes the amount of the non-specified packages.

Leave blank to apply to all purchases - note this will include any non-store purchases such as IP.Downloads purchases and donations. If you want the rule to apply to all store purchases, not non-store purchases, you should manually select all packages.
If yes, this rule will match if any of the above packages are being purchased. If no, the rule will only match if all of the above packages are being purchased.
Count renewals of the above packages?
If yes, renewals of the above packages will be counted too, otherwise renewals will be treated as a non-specified package.
Only give commission for the amount of the specified packages?
This is just used for your reference to identify the rule.
The user who referred the customer...
Can include any of the specified packages?
Leave blank to apply this rule to all groups.
Leave the dropdown blank to not apply this condition.
Leave blank to enable for all departments.

I will call Fedex to arrange a courier to pick this package up.

Fedex refused to process the shipment and returned the following error message:
If you cannot resolve this error, you can choose to make your own arrangements with Fedex and provide Nexus with a tracking number.
The tax class that will be added to Fedex shipping charges.
The account details provided are not valid, please check and try again.
The shipper details provided are not valid, please check and try again.
I already have an every-day pickup scheduled with Fedex and will provide this package to them on the next pickup.

You can provide a number of days that will be added to the delivery estimate returned from Fedex that is shown to the customer. This can be used to compensate for the time in between the order being placed and the time it is shipped.
When you mark an order shipped, the customer will be given the correct delivery date provided by Fedex.

Nexus will automatically only show options appropriate for each individual order (for example, international options will not be shown if the delivery address is in the US). You can however further restrict the available services by selecting only the ones you want to be available here.
Leave blank to keep all services available.

You can provide a price that will be added to the price returned from Fedex that will be included in the shipping costs the customer is charged. This can be used to cover packaging costs, etc.
You can also provide a negative value.

Once you have provided your Fedex account details, Fedex shipping methods will automatically become available.

Before you can use FedEx integration, you must contact FedEx and ask them to enable the following services for you:
Address Validation Service
Pickup Service
Ship Service
Proof of delivery is not yet available for this order.
Labels provided by the courier are not available until after shipment has been arranged.
How would you like to ship this package?

The submission could not be processed, this is usually because your session has timed out. Make a copy of your reply, and then refresh the page and try again.
A report cannot be generated because there is no available criteria. For example, if you are trying to view a purchase report, you do not have any packages in your store.
You cannot remove the renewal terms on a purchase which has it's renewals grouped with a parent purchase. Ungroup the renewals first.

At least one of the invoices selected is currently marked as paid. Invoices which have been paid cannot be acted on using this tool. You should perform the desired action on each invoice individually.
